intro: Echinocereus parkeri subsp. rayonesensis, commonly known as the Rayonesensis cactus, is a species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is a low-growing, spineless cactus with a short, thick stem that often branches at the base. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and conservation efforts.
